intro: Eriospermum flexum, commonly known as the soft-hairy flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a creeping stem with hairy, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces distinctive, elongated, seed-containing capsules. Eriospermum flexum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
